condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved and equitable use of community structures for the management of childhood illness especially ARIs, diarrhea and malaria including humanitarian situation

description.narrative: A total of 830 community health workers (CHWs) are trained in integrated modules on health, nutrition, water, sanitation and essential family practices. A trainer's guide based on integrated modules was developed and is used as a standard for trainers. In response to the humanitarian situation caused by cyclone Kenneth, the same CHWs were trained on the prevention of epidemic-prone diseases, sexually transmitted infections, including HIV, and water-borne diseases in humanitarian situations. About 42,000 people were reached by awareness-raising sessions and 17,000 insecticide-treated mosquito nets were distributed to the affected families. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2020
